title: Headaches Migraines App 1
description:
Relieve Migraine Headaches Naturally


There are many new migraine headache treatments available that can be both safe and effective. Natural treatments for migraine headaches are usually safer and cheaper than traditional pain medications.



And in many instances they can relieve pain just as well or even better than prescription or non-prescription drugs. The possibility of a negative reaction to a safe and natural migraine headache treatment is still there, but it is less with most natural treatment methods than it is with pain-relieving medications. 



Every person on the face of the earth is unique. Their body chemistry is different than anyone else’s. One person may find relief from their migraine headaches with one type of treatment while someone else may try that same treatment and find no relief at all.



No two people will experience the same reaction from the same treatment. But why is that?



Every body is made up of a mixture of chemicals. Every person produces certain chemicals in their body so that they will be able to function at their best. Histamines will increase gastric secretion and dilate the capillaries.



Insulin is secreted by the pancreas and helps regulate the blood sugar levels. Hormones are produced by the body for many different functions. Adrenaline (epinephrine) is produced in response to stress.



Every body is unique and produces different chemicals in differing amounts. When a person takes aspirin (a chemical) for their migraine headaches it changes the chemical make-up of that person’s body. 



You’ve always heard that when two chemicals, in the same amounts, at the same temperature, etc. are mixed together they will cause the same reaction.



That may be true, but when one chemical (such as aspirin) is taken by two separate people their reactions will never be exactly the same because no two people have identical chemicals in their body. One person taking aspirin will not have the same reaction as someone else taking aspirin. And it’s the same with natural migraine headache treatments.



Since no two people are identical no two people will respond exactly the same to a treatment method for migraine headaches.



So just because one migraine headache treatment does not work for one person does not mean it won’t work for your migraine headaches.



There are many effective alternatives to taking medications when it comes to relieving migraine headaches. You just have to try one for yourself to see if it will work for you.



One natural and popular treatment method for migraine headaches is chiropractic care, or chiropractic manipulations. Studies have shown that over 80% of headache patients find some type of relief for their headaches with chiropractic treatment.



And chiropractic treatment has been shown to be extremely safe. Spinal problems cause headaches and when these spinal problems are treated by chiropractors a high percentage of their patients experience relieve from their pain. 



Another natural way to relieve migraine headaches is biofeedback. This is a safe and potentially effective way to eliminate pain.



Biofeedback is not actually a treatment, but a training program designed to help a person develop the ability to control their autonomic (involuntary) nervous system.



Functions that are normally automatic in the body, such as blood pressure regulation or heart rate can be controlled voluntarily. This technique makes it possible for a person to control their own heart rate, blood pressure, skin temperature or relaxation of their muscles.



It’s no secret that stress causes muscle tension. And nobody will deny that muscle tension causes pain and headaches. And it’s also a fact that by relaxing this muscle tension, especially in the neck and head, it is possible to relieve the migraine headaches or neck pain that is being caused by the tension.

title: N1-Headache
description:
N1-Headache is a unique analytical tool for people with migraine. With it, you track your headaches and daily factors to scientifically discover and act on the unique pattern of everyday things that are associated with increasing, decreasing, or having no effect on your risk of attacks.  

N1-Headache's personalized self-management tools provide customized feedback to help you manage your attacks. Developed with world leading neurologists (go to our website to see our extensive clinical publications list), N1-Headache allows for secure data sharing with your clinician.

Use N1-Headache if you want to answer this question: How do my personal lifestyle factors and medications affect my migraine?

N1-Headache is a CE marked medical device.



* Daily diary
Easy-to-track your dietary, emotional, and environmental factors. Daily tracking enables our proprietary analytical system engine to identify factors that may lead to healthy days vs. migraine days for each individual.

* Digital report
A visual summary of your headaches and migraine attacks, their severity and the impact on your life. Compare these over time to determine how changes in your treatment, lifestyle, environment, mood or activity may affect your migraine.

* Personal Analytical Report / Share with your medical care team
Summarizes all your information and shows all of your tracking data including: Monthly Summary, Headache Calendar, Menstruation Diary (if applicable), Headache-related Disability in a PDF document that can be stored or shared with your healthcare provider.

Our app is regularly reviewed with headache specialists and used in clinical studies. 

** PREMIUM FEATURES **

* Individual Maps
Discover factors that are associated with increased or decreased risk of migraine attack, or are not associated with your attacks at all.
- Individual Protector Map
- Individual Trigger Map
- Individual No Association Map

*Personalize your diary even more
Make your daily diary match your needs by enabling or disabling predefined factors. Customize your personalized tracking list; even add your own customized factors to the extensive existing list developed with neurologists and headache specialists.

*Medication Overuse Risk
Medication overuse can make your headaches worse. The app lets you use a sophisticated database to track and analyze your medication. If you registered with a N1-Headache code given to you by your healthcare provider, N1-Headache will process your acute medication use and alert you and your clinician if you are too close or over established standards of medication overuse. This feature is intended for adult users only. 

* Directly link your account with your healthcare provider using an N1-Headache Code.


We're always working to make N1-Headache better, and we're counting on your feedback! 

Support: support@n1-headache.com
Twitter: twitter.com/curelator
Facebook: facebook.com/curelator

Thank you for rating us and leaving a review after your experience!

comments: Far too much information to add particularly when you're suffering from a very bad headache. It asks if you took medication but not if it helped. It asks if you're "sad", "angry", "irritable", "bored" or "relaxed".I fail to see how most of these are even relevant. Whether or not you have conducted housework... Did you visit a health care professional...well, given that we're in midst of a pandemic and can't get to see one unless you are quite literally dying... This app needs work.
UPDATE: after a few months, still love the app. It was really easy for my neurologist to look up the info for my appointment. 👍👍👍👍 Use this for my neurologist. Very easy.
Very useful app and well designed. The process is very easy.. Definitely would recommend it.
Was keeping a good many months then forgot to log. All my data is gone.

It's an okay app, i can't find one that separates migraines from ,,regular,, headaches, but what bothes me with this one is that it asks for my medication, yet when i tap to enter it, nothing shows, there is no way to enter it.

title: Migraine Support
description:
MyMigraineTeam is a social network and support group for those living with migraines. Get the emotional support you need from others like you, get practical tips to manage your life with migraines, and insights about treatment or therapies. MyMigraineTeam is the only social network where you can truly connect, make real friendships, and share daily ups and downs in a judgment-free place.

-Keep up and follow members photos & updates
-Quick photo buttons so you don't miss a beat 
-Post updates about the daily ups & downs 
-Get/Give instant hugs, likes & comments of support 
-Search the Q+A section/ask and answer questions 
-Add others to your team 
-Find others near you and like you
-Add your diagnosis and view others

MyMigraineTeam is for those living with migraines.


We welcome your feedback! 
Please email us at support@mymigraineteam.com with your comments & suggestions.

recentChanges:
Newly released: Badge count for your notifications in the app, and several feature enhancements.

We are also excited for what's coming up next: global search! In the meantime, we'd love to hear more feedback from you at support@mymigraineteam.com.
comments: I tried using this app about a year ago, and it was very rigid for being a social app. Other social apps are more encompassing, having a place where you can post to everyone and anyone, others then scroll through the homepage of these posts to easily see who is around & who they relate to. There's usually also a feature to search for friends by age, gender & country which is very helpful in finding someone to comfortably connect with. This app lacks those features as well as private chat. :/
Every time I try to go on even after uninstalling and installing it I keep getting a error fetching error...

It's a great idea, except you need to be 18 to use it. I'm not sure why since a lot of social media has the age limit at 13 (I'm 16), so I would like to know the reasoning behind it. I was excited to use this app since a lot media seems to cater to adults that suffer from migraines, and I usually can't relate because of that. I thought this would be a great for possibly connecting with others in my age group, but I guess not.

title: Curable: Back Pain, Migraine & Chronic Pain Relief
description:
Take control over chronic pain with the Curable app. Our step-by-step program will help you learn what is happening in your body and apply practical tools to reverse the cycle of pain. Let our smart coach, Clara, guide you through the latest developments in pain science with fun, easy-to-understand audio lessons. Identify, target, and eliminate the factors that are keeping your pain “stuck” through a series of guided, evidence-based exercises. Curable is a new type of chronic pain app, helping you to retrain your brain and nervous system for long-term results.

What you can do in the app:

-Learn about the neuroscience of pain through engaging audio lessons

-Reduce hypervigilence and fear of pain through practical, easy-to-apply techniques

-Optimize your nervous system to handle flare-ups more effectively with the “Panic Button"

-Calm your mind and body with guided meditations and visualizations specifically designed to target pain factors

-Reprocess strong emotions and life events that may have contributed to the development of pain

-Listen to interviews with physicians, pain scientists, and other experts

-Create a practical plan for re-incorporating joy and movement into your life

-Gain a new perspective on your symptoms and their significance through cognitive reframing

-Customize your experience by providing ongoing feedback to your smart coach, Clara

-Find inspiration, motivation, and support within our private community

The Curable program is evidence-based, and is recommended by physicians, physical therapists, and pain psychologists all over the world. It can be an important part of a treatment plan for migraine, fibromyalgia, neck & shoulder pain, back pain, sciatica, nerve pain, foot pain, hip pain, knee pain, RSI, hand and wrist pain, and more. 70% of Curable users experience some degree of relief in physical symptoms after just 30 days in the program.

Learn through engaging audio lessons that explain the neuroscience of pain as it applies to different aspects of life:
• Perfectionism
• People Pleasing
• Anxiety
• Depression
• Self Esteem
• Expectations
• Adversity
• Caregiving
• Parenting
• Major Life Events
• PTSD
• Childhood Stress
• The Stress of Pain
• Triggers

Retrain your brain to lessen the experience of pain through exercises of meditation, reflection, writing, CBT, and visualizations. For stories of recovery from real users, please read our reviews. To learn more about our approach, check out our podcast on iTunes: “Like Mind, Like Body."

IN THE PRESS:

"Very rarely, an app comes along that changes your life. I want to tell you about such an app, and how it changed mine.”
-Jon Evans, TechCrunch, ‘Curing the Incurable'

“A multidisciplinary pain program at the Mayo Clinic in Minnesota for treatment very similar to what Curable does (but in-person) costs $40,000.” -BizWest, 'App may change way patients, physicians approach chronic pain'

On "The Mighty":
'13 Favorite Apps for People With Chronic Conditions'
and '16 Products People With Chronic Pain Swear by That Fit in Your Purse'

Also featured in:
Women’s Health
Shape
Venture Beat
Elite Daily
Brit+Co

SUBSCRIPTION PRICING & TERMS
Curable offers the following auto-renewing subscriptions:
1 month: $14.99
1 year: $119.99

This price is for US customers. Pricing in other countries will be converted to your local currency depending on your country of residence.

Your subscription will automatically renew unless your subscription is canceled at least 24 hrs before the end of the current period. To manage your subscription go to your Google Play store and to Subscriptions. 

Curable also offers a Lifetime subscription which is paid for by a one-time upfront payment of $299.99 for unlimited access to the Curable app.

Privacy Policy:
https://www.curablehealth.com/privacy
Terms of Service:
https://www.curablehealth.com/terms

recentChanges:
With the release of Curable Version 4, we’ve made serious investments in your journey to recovery. Curable is better-equipped than ever to identify and target the unique combination of factors that are keeping you stuck in a cycle of pain. comments: Content is great... When I can access it. If I pause a recording it is very hard to get out to open again. I have to try repeatedly and don't know if it will work. I've given up and read the transcripts for some things but that doesn't work well for a meditation. Please fix these bugs!

I think this is a brilliant app and my pain is so much more manageable after only a month. My reason for only giving 4 stars is that an awful lot of the work is going back to childhood. I have done years of therapy and I just don't need this so a lot of exercises etc are useless to me. Some brain training exercises and the somatic taking is really helpful... Building new neural pathways.

As a musician, RSI has had a significant effect on me for years and finally now I'm able to play again. The app works on the premise that after the source of pain has healed, the sensation can remain because the brain gets stuck in a pain loop, exacerbated by anxiety and anticipation of the pain. The app is based on valid (and relatively recent) research and I'm delighted to say it has worked for me. Thank you Curable.

Great concept but app needs some fixing I love curable and what they do. The content is great but sometimes my meditations stop playing somewhere half way and it ruins the whole meditation experience. Another thing is sometimes the shortcut for the meditation will stay on my drop-down in which nothing will make it disappear unless I restart my phone. Just a bug I'm assuming hopefully the developers fix this

This app may help you. You will need to be able to tune your body to certain unknown frequencies and believe that the MRI study they refer to was not a flawed study from the start. If you are easily brainwashed this is the app for you. Worth a try if you are in constant pain. Good luck.

title: Home Remedies for Migraine
description:
IMPORTANT:
*Users who have APKs with previous version, may need to receive android.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE permission*

_________________


Over the years a large number of home remedies have been found for all types of medical conditions suffered by men and women worldwide. A large number of people have fallen victim to migraine attacks, but the good news is that there are many home remedies for migraine that you can choose.


In this app, we will discuss about:

• Natural Remedies For Migraines
• Superfoods for Migraines
• 6 Home Remedies For Migraine Headaches - Self Healing Migraines at Home
• Home Remedies For Migraines - 5 Easy Tips for Relief
• Home Remedies For Migraines - 3 Natural Remedies Use to Control My Migraines
• 21 Home Remedies For Migraines and Headaches
• 9 Natural Migraine Remedies That Use Stuff You Already Have At Home


[ Features ]

- Easy & simple app book guide
- Periodic update of content
- Support Offline Database (So, you can open it without internet connection)
- You can ask questions from our experts
- Send us your suggestions and we will add it


A little explaination about Home Remedies For Migraine:

Many people are suffering from different types of headaches and are looking for home remedies for migraine headaches these days. The headaches were driving many people insane have been influencing lives of many. Some people have the headaches for years and still cannot eliminate them.

Therefore finding a natural, healthy remedies for migraine headaches are essential. Al though the doctors gave prescription, they only help reduce the intensity temporarily. Later the headache comes back again. Furthermore, sometimes, these prescriptions, usually pills, may cause dizzy, fever or other side effects such as stomach problems.

Medicines are not the home remedies. After taking the prescribed medicine, many people still do not feel good about though the severe headaches relieved.

However, there are many natural remedies around you and you should try to take them. Nutritional supplements such as vitamin B2 B6 and magnesium seem to be effective in treating migraine headaches. Another type of home remedies for migraine headaches are herbs. Herbs that seem to be able to treat and prevent migraines include, ginger, feverfew and ginkgo.


Download Home Remedies For Migraine App to find more knowledge and tips..

title: Migraine
description:
Migraines are characterized by severe head pain often accompanied by other symptoms, which can be disabling in nature. These migraine symptoms include but are not limited to: nausea, vomiting, difficulty speaking, numbness or tingling, and sensitivity to light and sound. Migraines often tend to run in families, and recent research has identified certain genetic components. Migraines can affect people of all ages and often go undiagnosed in young children.

The duration of a migraine attack can vary, however most migraine attacks will last at least four hours. If you are experiencing symptoms for more than three days, you should seek help from your physician or visit the Emergency Room.

title: Nerivio
description:
Control your Nerivio device and track your migraine headaches.

The Nerivio app controls the Nerivio device - a wireless remote electrical neuromodulation device for the acute treatment of migraine with or without aura in patients 18 years of age or older who do not have chronic migraine. This prescription device is self-applied to the upper-arm and should be used in the home environment at the onset of migraine headache or aura.

Track your headaches and migraine symptoms in an easy-to-use advanced migraine diary which is included in the app.

For detailed information on the Nerivio device, please refer to www.theranica.com

Nerivio™ is a prescription device. Use the Nerivio device and this app only if you have a valid prescription and after consulting with your health care professional.

comments: Such a good working device! The app asks too many questions, yet I believe it's good to follow up on migraines.

Maybe this works for some headaches. I'm still out on that. The big problem is that it requires you to have your location on to start it up. Creepy. There is no need for location tracking to treat a headache. Oh, but they say your data will not be shared. BS. The second problem is the post survey question about treatment before using the nerivio. The medications list does not allow for multiple selections. Really? Who treats headaches with just one medicine? I use up to three in tandom.

this company/app requires far too many permissions and is a major invasion of privacy and HIPAA for what it does. they want to track locations, date of birth, usage, phone info, and other personal data for self gain and or to sell to other companies.... there is no way to use this device with out the app installed. Junk and don't waste your time less you don't care about your data and privacy
Does not work with android 11
Cool and convenient application

title: Ada – your health companion
description:
Ada helps you and your loved ones check symptoms and discover what might be causing them – day or night without an appointment. Whatever’s bothering you, from stomach problems to headache, Ada’s free symptom checker can help you find answers and let you know if you should see a doctor.

 Join the 10 million people who have already downloaded the world's most popular symptom check.  Doctors trained Ada for years, so you can get a prediagnosis within minutes. 


How do free symptom checks work?

You answer simple questions about your own or someone else’s health and symptoms.
Ada’s AI assesses your answers against its medical dictionary of thousands of disorders and medical conditions.
You receive a personalized assessment report that tells you what could be wrong and what to do next.


What can you expect from an assessment?

- Data privacy and security – we apply the strictest data regulations to protect you and keep your information private.
- Smart results – our core system connects medical knowledge with intelligent technology.
- Personalized health information – your guidance is personal to your unique health profile. 
- Assessments for loved ones – if you assess someone else, their information stays separate from your own. 
- Health checks – your assessments include information that may be relevant and helpful to your doctor. 
- 24/7 access – you can use the free symptom checker anytime, anywhere.


What can you tell Ada?

Ada answers medical questions of every kind. Here are some of the most common searches:

Symptoms
- Fever
- Allergic rhinitis
- Loss of appetite
- Headache
- Abdominal pain and tenderness 
- Nausea
- Fatigue
- Vomiting
- Dizziness


Medical conditions:
- Common cold 
- Influenza infection (flu)
- Viral sinusitis
- Diabetes
- Tension headache
- Migraine
- Chronic pain
- Fibromyalgia
- Arthritis
- Allergy
- Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
- Anxiety disorder
- Depression

Categories:
- Skin conditions such as rashes, acne, insect bites
- Pregnancy 
- Children’s health
- Sleeping problems
- Indigestion issues, such as vomiting, diarrhea
- Eye infections

Disclaimer
The Ada Health App is a Class I medical device in the European Union. Registration in other markets is pending.

We want to hear from you. If you have any feedback or just want to get in touch, reach us at hello@ada.com

comments: Pretty accurate heading. Again HEADING and not a diagnostic So people won't get it wrong about the app. Extremelly helpful, since the test I've inputed on was an already medical confirmed diagnosis and ADA has provided three oprions which one of them is the one I am on current medical treatment. So, I will definitely use it as a pre-docs visit since it helps to describe symptoms to the physician. First use no ads so far, which is great. Lets see if it stays this way.

I absolutely adore this app, I don't see myself ever getting rid of it. If you're ever unsure of what you have or need a guideline for what you may have, it is the most perfect app. It doesn't make you panic, it explains everything and is so calming when you're worried for the worst. Thank you to the creators! I adore this app and I'm so thankful for it!

This is a really awesome app, I use it every time I feel unwell. And it saved me so many trips to the doctor. The UI looks modern, descriptions of either symptoms or diseases is accurate while also easy to understand. And the best thing? it doesn't have ads, some kind of overpriced subscription or anything like that. this one is my must have.

It is generally a good app, but I put my symptoms in and it focused more on my mild headache and other small things than the actual problem that caused me to try this in the first place which was more important than that head ache, it does this quite a lot but other than this, it's quite good! It is a good way to track symptoms and I haven't seen many ads but it does need to work on the symptom assessment a bit more, but that said, it is hard to make that perfect but it can help.

This app is extremely helpful, I've used it dozens of times since I downloaded. Love that it remembers details about people other than me. It would be cool to have the option to import my medical records .... Not sure if that is something that would be possible to do? Either way, I've love this app, and it never takes long before I feel the need to download it onto a new phone.

title: Manage My Pain
description:
Chronic pain affects 1 in 5 individuals. It can be hard to explain to friends, family, and doctors. It can feel like it's taking control of your life and your mental health. Learn to conquer your chronic pain. Manage My Pain helps you and others better understand what you are going through. It has helped thousands of people with conditions like fibromyalgia, headaches, arthritis, or back pain better understand their symptoms and provide evidence of their pain for their doctors, insurance companies, or government agencies. Manage My Pain was created in partnership with industry-leading pain researchers - your doctor will actually read the reports from our app! Our daily reflections help people focus on their meaningful activities as opposed to the limitations created by their pain.

Manage My Pain will help you:
• Record how you're feeling: Easily describe your pain in less than 30 seconds
• Understand your unique pain criteria: Fully customizable options with each pain record let you identify factors such as how your pain feels, what the factors made the pain worse, which medications help you with your pain, and many more
• Reflect on your day: Take your mind off pain and record activities that are meaningful to you
• Highlight patterns and trends: Charts and graphs describe your results and get more powerful over time
• Track how well your meds are working: Add any medication to your profile and mark if it helps manage your pain
• Describe your pain to your doctor: Summarize your pain through unique reports that your doctor will actually read

Developed for patients suffering from and care-givers or medical professionals treating: 
• arthritis & rheumatism
• cancer 
• chronic pain
• headaches & migraines 
• fibromyalgia 

Use this pain management app to replace your hand-written: 
• pain diary 
• pain journal 
• pain log 
• pain tracker 

The Pro version adds the ability to view or report on more than the last 30 days. Reports are free to generate, however, those that contain advanced sections may require an additional credit to be purchased. An optional monthly subscription can be purchased so that an unlimited number of reports with advanced sections may be generated without the need for credits.
descriptionHTML:
Chronic pain affects 1 in 5 individuals. It can be hard to explain to friends, family, and doctors. It can feel like it's taking control of your life and your mental health. Learn to conquer your chronic pain. Manage My Pain helps you and others better understand what you are going through. It has helped thousands of people with conditions like fibromyalgia, headaches, arthritis, or back pain better understand their symptoms and provide evidence of their pain for their doctors, insurance companies, or government agencies. Manage My Pain was created in partnership with industry-leading pain researchers - your doctor will actually read the reports from our app! Our daily reflections help people focus on their meaningful activities as opposed to the limitations created by their pain.

Manage My Pain will help you:
• Record how you're feeling: Easily describe your pain in less than 30 seconds
• Understand your unique pain criteria: Fully customizable options with each pain record let you identify factors such as how your pain feels, what the factors made the pain worse, which medications help you with your pain, and many more
• Reflect on your day: Take your mind off pain and record activities that are meaningful to you
• Highlight patterns and trends: Charts and graphs describe your results and get more powerful over time
• Track how well your meds are working: Add any medication to your profile and mark if it helps manage your pain
• Describe your pain to your doctor: Summarize your pain through unique reports that your doctor will actually read

Developed for patients suffering from and care-givers or medical professionals treating:
• arthritis & rheumatism
• cancer
• chronic pain
• headaches & migraines
• fibromyalgia

Use this pain management app to replace your hand-written:
• pain diary

The Pro version adds the ability to view or report on more than the last 30 days. Reports are free to generate, however, those that contain advanced sections may require an additional credit to be purchased. An optional monthly subscription can be purchased so that an unlimited number of reports with advanced sections may be generated without the need for credits.

comments: **UPDATE** after receiving response from customer support (which was expedient and right on the money for what I needed). I absolutely LOVE this app!!! (upgrade from 4 stars to 5!!) Once I was clear on how to use app, I really appreciate having somewhere to log my daily concerns. I do wish there were more specific body parts, but I LOVE that u can put notes in and be more specific there.

Really great free app with incredibly reasonably priced premium levels (although I've not needed to upgrade from free yet so can't comment on their pros & cons). You can add your own pain descriptors and chart things like mental fog and fatigue. It doesn't take too long to fill out and you can easily change the entry date. The only thing I "don't like" is that it defaults to filling out the daily reflection rather than pain when opening the app. Definitely recommend for chronic pain sufferers!

Really useful for tracking pain, and I like all the options they give you for stuff. Plus you can make your own! I just started tracking my pain and this app has helped give a visual of how much I neglect to address my physical health. Glad I stumbled upon this :)

I started using this app because I know I will need a lengthy history to be diagnosed with fibromyalgia. I like how easy this app is to use and record my daily symptoms and over all how Im feeling. This app is super helpful.
Love this. Most apps that track your activities etc are very limited without subscribing but this one has a lot of free features and is a great way of keeping track of patterns

title: Remedies for Migraine
description:
Millions of people suffer from painful migraines. So, what can you do when an excruciating migraine strikes all of a sudden? Following are some great home remedies for migraine headaches that you can apply quickly and get fast relief.

A migraine is an acute headache that is extremely painful and can even be a disabling condition for many. Migraines are common among the population as a whole. In the U.S., 18% of women and 6% of men report having had at least one migraine headache in the past year. Migraines affect about 30 million people in the United States. They may occur at any age, but usually begin between the ages of 10 and 40 and may begin to diminish after age 50. Some people experience several migraines a month, while others have only a few migraines throughout their lifetime. Approximately 75% of all migraine sufferers are women.

Some people complain that visual problems accompany their migraines. These visual symptoms include; bright shimmering lights around objects or at the edges of the field of vision, zigzag lines, wavy images, or hallucinations.

Other symptoms may include severe pain in the area of the temples, around the eyes or in the back of the head. In addition, migraines may be accompanied by nausea, fatigue or tiredness, and mood changes a day or two preceding the headache.

In some cases, migraines appear to run in families. If one of your parents suffered with migraines, there is a good chance that you will get them too.

So, what events trigger severe migraines? In most cases, migraines are brought on by the following triggers; stress, anxiety, fatigue, certain medications, alcohol and certain foods. Monosodium glutamate (also know as MSG), is thought to be a factor in the cause of severe migraines for a number of people. MSG is frequent used ingredient in Chinese and Asian cuisine.

Conventional home remedies for migraine headaches focus on trigger avoidance and symptom control. If you find that eating certain foods or situations are frequently followed by a migraine, avoid it in the future. This is common sense, but many people do not make the connection between the two occurrences.

Another one of the good home remedies for migraine headaches is moderation in your consumption of alcohol and caffeine. These are common triggers. Home remedies for migraine headaches should also include getting adequate sleep, eating meals at regular intervals, and drinking plenty of fluids. Dehydration is also a very common trigger for severe migraines.

Massage therapies are often very effective forms of home remedies for migraine headaches. If you feel a migraine coming on, get a massage. Headaches and severe migraines are frequently caused by stress. When you are stressed, your muscles tighten up. A massage works to delicately stretch these tight muscles and help alleviate the accumulated stress in your body. By working the muscles in your neck and shoulders, as well as those at the base of the skull, muscles relax and the discomfort will be eliminated. Ideally, this technique works best if someone else does it for you but, if that is not an option, it is possible to give yourself a neck and head massage. A massage is one my personal favorite home remedies for migraines.

Some people get some relief by applying either a cold or warm compress to the effected area. Most people report that a cold compress works best, but if that is not effective, try a warm compress.

Acupressure is also one of the good home remedies for migraine headaches. Like acupuncture, it is a well-known alternative treatment for many medical problems that has been used for thousands of years. To get headache pain relief, squeeze the fleshy area between your thumb and forefinger for at least five minutes for one of the quick remedies for migraines. Many folks also can relieve migraine pain by gently rubbing [using small circular motions] the little indentations just in front of your ears.

title: Migraine Trainer
description:
Migraine Trainer provides self-management tools and resources to help users ages 13+ understand the causes of their migraines, and take a greater role in their treatment with an individual migraine management plan.  Key features include action steps, daily goals, and cognitive exercises.  

This app was created by the National Institutes of Health, National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke. NIH is the nation's medical research agency, includes 27 Institutes and Centers and is a component of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. NIH is the primary federal agency conducting and supporting basic, clinical, and translational medical research, and is investigating the causes, treatments, and cures for both common and rare diseases.

title: Migraine Remedies
description:
Stop Chronic Migraine Pain and Tension Headaches From Destroying Your Life…

 

Proven steps anyone can take to overcome even the worst chronic head pain…

Are you someone that suffers from:

·        Tension Headaches

·        Migraine Headaches

·        Cluster Headaches

·        Stress Headaches…

Here’s a sneak peak at what you’ll learn:

·         What types of medical treatments are suitable for the type of headache you have, and how to talk to your doctor about them…

·         What natural remedies are worth trying if you suffer from this type of headache…

·         Find out if you can prevent your headache using preventative drugs including Imitrex or Relpax, or take advantage of natural remedies that prevent headaches…

·         Find out why it is so important to keep a headache diary, and how to start your very own, so you and your doctor can work closely to uncover the cause for your distress…

·         And much more!

Everyone knows what a headache feels like, but not everyone enjoys the ease of relief available…

Your brain is packed full of nerve endings that if triggered in just the right way, they send out pain signals to your head, resulting in you guessed it… headaches!

BUT… nobody deserves to be in pain most of the time. Headaches are one of the most common problems people face in the modern world. In fact, migraines rank as the 19th most common cause for disability.

What can you do about it?

Having severe headaches interfere with your ability to work and play. It’s time you found relief from your headache. Even if you suffer from occasional headaches, it’s time you found out what the exact cause is so you can find the perfect treatment!

When it comes to headaches, you will find that it is a condition that will be painful in the head, neck, and even back area. You will need to understand that the headache is not always just a pain. It could mean a sign of some sort and you will need to see a doctor if you get a lot of headaches. When it comes to symptoms or being a sign, you will need to consider that it is very rarely anything but a headache, but you will want to see a doctor if the headaches are persistent. 

As for causes for the headaches, you will find that it could be tension, eye strain, low blood sugar, sinuses, and even dehydration. You will also find that it could be a symptom of some life-threatening conditions like high blood pressure, brain tumors, and meningitis. You will also get a headache if you are injured in the head. Head trauma is very serious and you should seek medical treatment. You will also notice that the headache could simply be a part of your menstrual cycle, because you are fluctuating in estrogen levels. 

As for treatment you will be able to take some of the over-the-counter painkillers like Ibuprofen or aspirin. This will help you to get rid of the headache, but you will want to avoid some of your triggers, if you are able to identify them. Things like stress and even particular foods should be avoided in order for you to avoid having a headache. You will also want to seek medical attention if you feel that your headaches are persistent.

Most of your headaches are going to be nothing at all, however, you will still want to get checked out so that you can avoid having it manifest into something that is very serious. You will need to keep in mind that you will want to keep a headache journal. This way you can identify if you just have some specific trigger. Often your headaches will mean nothing, but it is always safe to jot down what you were doing when you got the headache and rather or not you have anything in common with other headaches. This way you can simply avoid the food or activity that makes you get headaches.

· And much more!

Everyone knows what a headache feels like, but not everyone enjoys the ease of relief available…

Your brain is packed full of nerve endings that if triggered in just the right way, they send out pain signals to your head, resulting in you guessed it… headaches!

BUT… nobody deserves to be in pain most of the time. Headaches are one of the most common problems people face in the modern world. In fact, migraines rank as the 19th most common cause for disability.

What can you do about it?

Having severe headaches interfere with your ability to work and play. It’s time you found relief from your headache. Even if you suffer from occasional headaches, it’s time you found out what the exact cause is so you can find the perfect treatment!

When it comes to headaches, you will find that it is a condition that will be painful in the head, neck, and even back area. You will need to understand that the headache is not always just a pain. It could mean a sign of some sort and you will need to see a doctor if you get a lot of headaches. When it comes to symptoms or being a sign, you will need to consider that it is very rarely anything but a headache, but you will want to see a doctor if the headaches are persistent.

As for causes for the headaches, you will find that it could be tension, eye strain, low blood sugar, sinuses, and even dehydration. You will also find that it could be a symptom of some life-threatening conditions like high blood pressure, brain tumors, and meningitis. You will also get a headache if you are injured in the head. Head trauma is very serious and you should seek medical treatment. You will also notice that the headache could simply be a part of your menstrual cycle, because you are fluctuating in estrogen levels.

As for treatment you will be able to take some of the over-the-counter painkillers like Ibuprofen or aspirin. This will help you to get rid of the headache, but you will want to avoid some of your triggers, if you are able to identify them. Things like stress and even particular foods should be avoided in order for you to avoid having a headache. You will also want to seek medical attention if you feel that your headaches are persistent.

Most of your headaches are going to be nothing at all, however, you will still want to get checked out so that you can avoid having it manifest into something that is very serious. You will need to keep in mind that you will want to keep a headache journal. This way you can identify if you just have some specific trigger. Often your headaches will mean nothing, but it is always safe to jot down what you were doing when you got the headache and rather or not you have anything in common with other headaches. This way you can simply avoid the food or activity that makes you get headaches.
summary: Proven Methods For Eliminating The Most Powerful Of Headaches

title: Beating Headaches and Migraine
description:
Up to 90% of the general population reported experiencing headaches at some point in their lives. Headache is a complex phenomenon. Many migraine attacks are caused by stress triggers. Some of them: 

•Stress and time pressure, major losses, anger and conflict. 
•Certain smells, tobacco smoke, light glare or dazzle, weather changes. 
•Monthly periods, birth control pills, estrogen therapy. 
•Too much, too little or interrupted sleep. 
•Hunger, fasting, specific foods or beverages. 
•Excessive activity. 
•Certain medicines 

Learning to avoid those triggers or your response to them can help in the treatment of migraines and tension headaches. Anything that helps you lower stress levels and encourage relaxation can be beneficial. The logical choice in this case is hypnosis, which can help with any kind of pain that is triggered by stress. 

This app is specially created to help you prevent and cope with the migraine symptoms. By regular listening you can learn to easily achieve the beneficial for your body and mind relaxation state.

title: Bearable - Symptoms & Mood tracker
description:
✅ All health tracking in one place

Tired of juggling multiple apps to keep track of your mood, symptoms, sleep, exercise, diet, and medication? We think all of this should be kept in one convenient place so that you and your health professional can get the full picture.

✅ Reclaim control over your well-being

Bearable empowers people to reclaim control over their well-being by making mood and symptom tracking simple, convenient, and accessible to all. Making entries in our health diary is quick and effortless, so you can focus more energy on getting better.  

The app has been shaped by our community of thousands of people with varying chronic health issues.

✅ Gain useful insights with just a few clicks a day

With just a few simple clicks each day our intelligent health diary can help you to gain insights into which daily activities and health factors are positively and negatively affecting your mental and physical health.


Bearable helps you to:

✔️ Record your mood and symptoms in seconds, or go into more detail with an additional note. 
✔️ Fully customise your daily activities and health factors, such as sleep, diet, exercise and medication/supplements. 
✔️ Gain insights into how your daily activities and health factors impact your mood and symptoms using our graphs, calendar and stats pages.
✔️ Keep everything in one place with our neat health timeline, so that you can get the full picture. Use our search function to filter just what you want to see or show your health professional.
✔️ Come prepared to your next doctor or therapist appointment - no need to struggle to remember a detailed health timeline for the last week or month.
✔️ Make journaling a healthy habit with our quick, simple and enjoyable entry process.

And there’s much more…

➕ Set Reminders - Fully customise your reminders, whether it's a general reminder to make a diary entry or a reminder to take your medication and supplements. 
➕ Share and Export -  Export data securely to yourself or your health professional
➕ Automatic health data sync - You can choose to allow the app to automatically gather data such as Sleep and Steps taken from your phone.
➕ Dark mode - Change at night to a display easier on the eyes.
➕ Restore data across devices - Restore your data between Apple & Android devices.


🔐 PRIVATE & SECURE

Rest easy knowing your data is encrypted securely on our servers. You have full control over your data and can delete it from within the app at any time.  It’s important to emphasise that we will never under any circumstances sell any personal data to anyone.


💟 MADE BY PEOPLE WHO UNDERSTAND AND CARE

Created by individuals who have lived with mental and physical health issues themselves.  With feedback and feature requests from a research group of thousands of people with a wide variety of chronic diseases and health conditions, including Anxiety, Depression, CFS (ME), MS (Multiple Sclerosis), Fibromyalgia, Endometriosis, Bipolar, BPD, PTSD, Migraines, Headaches, Vertigo, Cancer (Chemo Symptoms), Arthritis, Crohns, Diabetes, IBS and IBD.  Our aim is to make our symptom tracker simple and accessible to everyone, even if suffering from the fatigue and brain fog that often accompanies many conditions.

We have created a real sense of community around Bearable and will continue to listen closely to those who need it most.  We are committed to continue improving upon this app that could help many people start to feel like they can reclaim control over their health.  If you have any questions, feedback or feature requests, please send them over to james@bearable.app.  We’d love to hear from you.




Credit to Freepik for icons

comments: This is absolutely the best of its kind. I have never seen such a comprehensive, customizable, well-designed app that serves as many functions as this one. I've already shown it to multiple friends/therapists. For those of you moaning about the cost... seriously, getting the subscription will set you back just over $2/month. I work professionally with highly impoverished individuals who do have to count every penny, but come on. Most people can shell out a couple bucks without harm.

The app lets you log your mood, any symptoms you are having, and a number of factors that you think may be affecting your mood/symptoms. The default categories to log are good, but you can add/remove/edit all of the categories to fit you better. It's super easy to fill out, even when I'm not feeling well. It (sometimes) feels like I'm logging meaningless information, but then when I click on the Insights tab, it shows me tons of relevant information about which factors are influencing my mood (or any other symptom I log!). Turns out listening to music and video chats work wonders for my mood--good to know! This is also a wonderful way to record how I'm feeling over time--it lets me easily decipher long-term changes in my wellbeing, which is great information to discuss with medical professionals.

I really like this app, it's easy to use and the design is nice and the ability to customize it to your needs is great. However, the syncing isn't very reliable. I have a phone and a tablet, and downloaded it on both, I tried to log in on the tablet, and only a few entries were visible. Later I went to look at the one on my phone, and half the entries are gone, and so are factors I added. I want to keep using this app, but if it's going to randomly forget things that's a problem.

I have tried multiple times in the past to find a way that I could easily log my moods in a way that felt nuanced and meaningful but also flexible and customizable, but this is the first app I have ever seen that got it right. For once, I am finding it convenient to do quick check ins and even monitor my food and water intake which I never thought I'd have the patience to do. You don't have to get premium, but it's well worth it at least to support a great app.

Brilliant App & well worth paying for. I wanted an app to record daily symptoms to enable me to give an accurate report to my GP. This app has everything I wanted & more. Being able to write notes by each symptom is so helpful & the insight reports are incredible. I did have a little snag when I first signed up for the free trial, but I made contact, explained the situation & James helped me to sort it all out. The app has been fantastic ever since. Thank you bearable team 🙏🏻🥰

title: Migraine Xplained
description:
Migraine Xplained explains what migraines are through the illustrated story of Katie – a real person! The story reflects her journey, her experiences, and her advice to others.

Create an account to enjoy all of the features available to those who are suffering from or want to know more about migraine:

- A notes section to write down your own notes and questions about migraine and share them with your doctor.

- Finally, learn about migraine through the eyes of a real person – Katie! Her story reflects her experiences and her advice to others.

title: Home Remedies for Migraine
description:
Do you suffer from migraines? Are you tired of those annoying headaches?
We have created an app with home remedies to relieve migraine. Remember that they are not substitutes for any medical treatment. If you have doubts you should consult a professional.

- Ice: It is the most used home remedy throughout life to relieve headache. Put a bag of ice (better if it is wrapped in a towel) on your forehead or on the back of your head if you feel pressure on them. You can also put it on the soles of your feet.

- Lavender: If you are suffering from a migraine attack, lavender oil will help relieve pain. Boil water and put in it a few drops of this oil to breathe the vapors.

- Watermelon peel: Put a watermelon peel on your temples and you will relieve the headache.

- Ginger. Take several infusions of this plant daily if you are suffering a crisis. As it has anti-inflammatory effects it will relieve you.

- Chamomile Prepare a mixture by boiling this plant and adding a spoonful of honey and the juice of a lemon. Put the mixture in a bottle and drink it throughout the day.

- Cayenne pepper . Dilute in water two or three tablespoons. Take this warm mixture.

- Coffee . Coffee has vasodilatory effects so it is considered that it can help relieve the pain caused by migraine.

All these home remedies and many more you can find them in our free app. Through explanatory videos you will learn techniques and home remedies to alleviate or prevent a migraine attack. Download it for free and try it. You will discover that it is very easy to use and it is also available in several languages.

title: Get Migraine-free! Hypnose
description:
***The Audio files are high quality and therefore quite large, a good wifi Connection is necessary to download***If you face any issue with your Android application, please do write to our support email address before rating the application ***

* Be pain free and fully relaxed once more!
* Reap the benefits of reactivating your own body rhythms!
* Rediscover and support lasting personal satisfaction!

The numbers are alarming: Every third person suffers regularly from headaches and one in ten suffers from migraines. Therefore it comes as no surprise that those affected frequently reach for painkillers. However, this can have serious consequences, because the frequent use of painkillers may result in drug-induced headaches - a true vicious circle!

Alternative methods are often more effective and efficient for getting rid of the annoying pain of headaches and migraines - especially in the long term! They not only relieve the pain, but also treat the problem at its source. One example is the hypnosis program "Get Migraine-Free! Headache and migraine relief by Hypnosis".

"Get Migraine-Free!" is based on the healing power of hypnosis and supports the relaxation process which is particularly essential for the treatment of headaches and migraines. It works like this: your subconsciousness activates your „inner doctor“, the awareness of your own needs raises and you learn to listen to your own rhythm again - with noticeably successful results! 

Tension disappears from the blood vessels in your head, irritability diminishes, frustration over the constant pain fades away and exhaustion is replaced by targeted relaxation. Special voice patterns and goal-oriented suggestions lead the psychotherapy practitioner through a visualization process which allows the body and mind to relax. The music developed for this programme promotes the relaxing effects of hypnosis and contributes to the success of the audio program.

ABOUT KIM FLECKENSTEIN

„Get Migraine-free!“ was designed by well-known German Hypnotherapist Kim Fleckenstein. Kim Fleckenstein is a certified alternative practitioner in psychotherapy, a clinical Hypnotherapist and NLP-Master-Coach. Based in Munich she already published a range of best-selling self-help and hypnosis programs as Apps and MP3s under the label GET ON APPS!. Her unique technique and self experiences have helped to create the special character and heart of her recordings. Together with professional and native speaker Cathy Weber she also publishes her programs in English.

This special hypnosis program was developed in collaboration with Prof. Dr. Ralf Herwig according to the latest knowledge of medicine and hypnotherapy. Prof. Dr. Ralf Herwig is Head of the Andrology and Urology Department at the Vienna General Hospital.

WHAT YOU GET

• A highly effective 25-Minute professional Hypnosis session using the latest hypnotic and relaxation techniques – suitable for both, beginners and more experienced users.
• The professional and warm voice of Cathy Weber, which leads you into a deep state of relaxation and change.
• A high quality and state of the art recording.
• Professionally composed background music for every program by CSW Music.
• Customize your settings and discover other useful features.

PLEASE NOTE

Do not listen to this program while operating a motor vehicle or during any other activity that requires your full attention.  This program does not replace a doctor or any other medical aids.  

The best effect can be achieved by listening to this program once a day over a period of 4 weeks.

GET MIGRAINE-FREE! IS YOUR PERSONAL COACH! ALWAYS WITH YOU! GIVE IT A TRY, NOW!

Therefore it comes as no surprise that those affected frequently reach for painkillers. However, this can have serious consequences, because the frequent use of painkillers may result in drug-induced headaches - a true vicious circle!

Alternative methods are often more effective and efficient for getting rid of the annoying pain of headaches and migraines - especially in the long term! They not only relieve the pain, but also treat the problem at its source. One example is the hypnosis program "Get Migraine-Free! Headache and migraine relief by Hypnosis".

"Get Migraine-Free!" is based on the healing power of hypnosis and supports the relaxation process which is particularly essential for the treatment of headaches and migraines. It works like this: your subconsciousness activates your „inner doctor“, the awareness of your own needs raises and you learn to listen to your own rhythm again - with noticeably successful results!

Tension disappears from the blood vessels in your head, irritability diminishes, frustration over the constant pain fades away and exhaustion is replaced by targeted relaxation. Special voice patterns and goal-oriented suggestions lead the psychotherapy practitioner through a visualization process which allows the body and mind to relax. The music developed for this programme promotes the relaxing effects of hypnosis and contributes to the success of the audio program.

ABOUT KIM FLECKENSTEIN

„Get Migraine-free!“ was designed by well-known German Hypnotherapist Kim Fleckenstein. Kim Fleckenstein is a certified alternative practitioner in psychotherapy, a clinical Hypnotherapist and NLP-Master-Coach. Based in Munich she already published a range of best-selling self-help and hypnosis programs as Apps and MP3s under the label GET ON APPS!. Her unique technique and self experiences have helped to create the special character and heart of her recordings. Together with professional and native speaker Cathy Weber she also publishes her programs in English.

This special hypnosis program was developed in collaboration with Prof. Dr. Ralf Herwig according to the latest knowledge of medicine and hypnotherapy. Prof. Dr. Ralf Herwig is Head of the Andrology and Urology Department at the Vienna General Hospital.

WHAT YOU GET

• A highly effective 25-Minute professional Hypnosis session using the latest hypnotic and relaxation techniques – suitable for both, beginners and more experienced users.
• The professional and warm voice of Cathy Weber, which leads you into a deep state of relaxation and change.
• A high quality and state of the art recording.
• Professionally composed background music for every program by CSW Music.
• Customize your settings and discover other useful features.

PLEASE NOTE

Do not listen to this program while operating a motor vehicle or during any other activity that requires your full attention. This program does not replace a doctor or any other medical aids.

The best effect can be achieved by listening to this program once a day over a period of 4 weeks.

GET MIGRAINE-FREE! IS YOUR PERSONAL COACH! ALWAYS WITH YOU! GIVE IT A TRY, NOW!

title: Migraine Tracker
description:
Migraine Tracker is a simple event tracking app.  Originally designed as a personal application to track migraines, it can be used to track any recurring event's time and duration, such as contractions, pet exercise, or noisy neighbors.

The UI is designed to be as simple as possible, allowing ease of use during severe headaches or other events where a complex or feature-heavy UI is unwelcome.

Migraine Tracker does not, and is not intended to, diagnose or treat any condition.  It merely collects data for later analysis by a qualified professional instead of using paper forms or notebooks.  All data is stored locally on your Android device, and only event duration and score is stored.

The source of Migraine Tracker is available under the GPL v.2 at SourceForge.

title: migraine or headache guide
description:
You often have headaches, to the point that these headaches stun you several hours? It may be a sign of a migraine. How to recognize a migraine from a classic skull sickness? What is ophthalmic migraine? What treatments to overcome it? You are told everything to end these headaches
First sign of migraine: you have a headache. On one side or both, the location of the pain is often close to the eye. If your head seems stuck in a vise, you feel your heartbeat right up in the veins of your face, this is a migraine.

These headaches last more in time than a classic headache. Migraineurs tend to get used to analgesics and therefore have difficulty in clearing their migraine.

Strong headaches of this type can even result in temporary nausea or visual loss.

Migraine is a health disorder affecting many women, but also men. It would seem that the fact of being migraine can be transmitted by heredity.
to know more between here ....

What is blue light?

It's part of a natural light spectrum, which disturbs the circadian rhythm and causes sleeplessness. Unlike red light, bluelight blocks the secretion of melatonin, sleep hormone, after midnight and causes restlessness. Retinal neurons are in danger if night filter book light anti glare is not used after twilight.

• Eye strain and tired eyes

title: Tension Headache
description:
"Tension Headaches" it's kind of pressure around your forehead or the back of your head and neck. Some people say it feels like a clamp squeezing the skull and the others say that a tension headache feels like a tight band around their forehead. Often called stress headaches, they’re the most common type for adults.

The majority of people who suffer from "Tension Headaches" have episodic headaches, which happen one or two times per month on average. However, "Tension Headaches" can also be chronic. According to the international health organizations, chronic headaches affect about 3 percent of population and include headache episodes that last for more than 15 days per month. Women are twice as likely to suffer from "Tension Headaches" as men.

There are many "Tension Headaches" remedies. Medications can ease your pain, but changing your lifestyle to control stress or avoid triggers works well, too, and may prevent you from getting headaches. What works for one person may not work for another, so work with your doctor to find the best remedy for you.

title: Headache Log
description:
Track your headaches so you can gain insight into their frequency, triggers and what remedies work. Anyone who suffers from headache or migraines knows that they can be unpredictable and interrupt your activities. With this headache log, you'll be able to easily see how frequently your headaches occur and how severe they are. You can track what remedies and medications work for each type of headache and it's severity. Additionally, track any notes before the onset of the headache to help you identify your triggers (such as diet, sleep, stress and other activities).

The Headache Log is also a great tool to be able to quantify your headache history and frequency to your medical team when seeking advice.

title: DW Migraine
description:
Deep Waves Ltd. Migraine is a groundbreaking brainwave sound therapy for migraines and headaches.

Migraine is a neurological disease characterized by recurrent moderate to severe headaches often in association with a number of autonomic nervous system symptoms. Typically the headache affects one half of the head, is pulsating in nature, and lasts from 2 to 72 hours. Associated symptoms may include nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light, sound, or smell. 

The migraine is believed to be a neurovascular disorder. The primary theory is related to increased excitability of the cerebral cortex and abnormal control of pain neurons in the trigeminal nucleus of the brainstem.

Deep Waves Ltd. Migraine consist of 2 treatment sessions and one session for suppression of migraine.

Session 1 and 2 are a treatment for preventing of migraines.  
Session 1 and 2 should not be used during migraine.
Session 1 and 2 are both 22 minutes.

Session 3 is an exclusive therapy for suppression of migraine during migraine.
Session 3 is 13 minutes

Both sessions are crucial to have a complete treatment!

This treatment requires large headphones or high quality earphones with Left and Right placed correctly !

Get ready for a total natural healing.

Enjoy your explorations.

title: Different Types of Headaches
description:
Different Types of Headaches Cause Loss of Productivity, US companies are losing $13 billion dollars a year because of the different types of headaches that are affecting the work force. This figure is lost through actual time off and lower productivity while at work due to impaired function.

Headaches in their various forms affect nearly half the world's population making it a universal global condition. The World Health Organization has claimed that they fall within the five most debilitating conditions that affect women.

We will learn about:

tmj headaches	
what causes a headache	


Features of the app:

Can Use For Offline App
Updated regularly
You can ask questions from our experts
Simple app book Knowledge like pocket on your phone
You can also send us your suggestions and we will add them inside the app For more updates.

Read also different types of headaches:

Men are more fortunate than their female counterparts as the W.H.O. claim that headaches occur within the 10 most debilitating conditions for them.

Cluster headaches and migraine are classed as the most intense, severe headaches. These types of headaches have been known to bring on vomiting and nausea however the severity and frequency is unique to each individual.

Although tension headaches are not classed as intense as cluster or migraine headaches the disability caused by these less severe headaches is in fact greater due the the increased number of people that suffer from them.

There are roughly:

* 11% people who suffer from migraine

* 42% of people who suffer from tension headaches

3% of people who suffer from chronic headaches (combined symptoms that affect them more than 15 days per month).

Migraines and headaches not only have an economical effect on society they also can take a great toll of relationships. Migraine sufferers particularly fall into this category with as many as 70% claiming to suffer from depression and short-term memory loss.

What treatments are available

Over the counter medicines are a seemingly quick solution and are readily available from almost anywhere but taking this type of medication on a too frequent basis can lead to unexpected problems of their own.

Some of the side effects to over the counter medications can be drowsiness, lack of concentration and even more unwelcoming is the fact that they can lead to an 'overuse headache' which is often more severe and painful than the original headache.

Synergistic Treatment Approach

Different types of headaches can be prevented and treated very simply with a synergistic approach. They can, more often than not, be treated more effectively and without the need for medication. This type of treatment usually involves looking at your lifestyle and learning a few natural healing techniques that can have amazing results.

Didnt need to use this ap (thank God no cluster headaches with the season change) .only issue I had was the outrageous amount of battery it used (that is the only reason I finally have to delete this app my battery charged all night and in a matter of 5 hours my battery went from 100% down to 40%.I am not tech illiterate, I know to do my phone maintenance and I know to keep programs closed when not using.. it was just this app for some reason. New to this. Glad there is something out there to help me keep a diary. My cycle started one week ago and its been hell. The pain tends to go easy on me at about the 3 week mark. Can someone help me me advise on meds. The doctors here just keep sending me in circles. Please and thank you

title: Headary: headache diary
description:
Headary is the headache diary in your phone. It’s designed for people suffering from migraine, tension-type headache, medication-overuse headache or cluster headache. 

The main task of this app is to find out whether your medications are effective or not and decide if your therapy should be changed. Using it, you can collect important information about your health: how often do you have your headache, when it occurs, how long headache lasts and what symptoms accompany it. It is very important to keep a diary every day. You can upload your data to send a headache report to your doctor by Email. Based on this information, your doctor can make a correct diagnosis and start an effective treatment. Being the result of collaboration with neurologists, Headary is the best alternative to paper headache diaries. We hope that user-friendly interface and two color themes with no complicated information will make use of Headary comfortable and easy-to-understand. Stop a headache with Headary.

title: Aura Migraine Simulator
description:
Note! Use this app for education only. I show people around me, to show how an Aura Migraine attack will look but never watch is myself because I also suffer from Aura Migraine myself.
Millions of people, around the world, suffering from migraine with an aura, that appear, in front of their eyes and that only they can see.
This is called Aura migraine or classic migraine. This app is a true story, because I suffer from this weekly or monthly.
Now,you can see the aura too, through some steps,with this Aura Migrane Simulator.
My intention with the app is, that it can be used as some education of what an aura migraine is and how to get some experience of, what it feels to have an aura, flashing  around before your eyes. The aura attack is reduced to minutes with the plus and minus buttons and there is also a stop button that stop the aura attack. We who have aura migraine, is not that fortunately, to  able to stop the aura that way so we have to deal with it, under 35 minutes in real. There is no cure for the aura yet, but i hope in the future, their will be a cure.
This is an extremely handicap and it's difficult to manage, i can tell. I suffered in 50 years now from it and counting.

title: PainLog - migraine, pain and medication tracker
description:
PainLog is a unique app in making migraine, pain and medication tracking and reporting super easy.

It's important to keep track of used medications in order to avoid pain becoming chroninc. With PainLog you can record the pain attack with one button click and check the current situation straight from the home screen. 

It's easy to save the intensity of the pain and create comprehensive reports ready to be sent. PainLog supports multiple users, so you can track e.g. your children too. Editing editing saved entries is very easy too. The report unveils the amount of pain days and medication days as well as total amount of pain attacks and meds used. As a convenience feature, you can select your favorite color theme from multiple options.

The application helps doctors, nurses and users workload by automating and digitising manual phases to export, transform, present and send data that is needed for pain analysis and treatment. PainLog produces results and reports automatically and provides means to send them via email, whatsapp*, messenger* etc. *) if installed.

Features

- Easy to save pain attack intensity and details like e.g. symptoms, medication, occasion
- Save your preferred medication details, symptoms etc. for easier usage 
- Easy to modify entries
- Monthly details about pain days, medication days, total amount of pains and meds
- Comprehensive report and chart that can be sent to e.g. doctor
- Data stored securely and is available for multiple devices. No need for manual backup
- Support for multiple users and devices
- Select your favorite color theme from multiple options
- Available for Android and iOS
- Language: English

title: Headache Disease: Causes,Diagnosis, and Management
description:
Headache is the symptom of pain anywhere in the region of the head or neck. It occurs in migraines (sharp, or throbbing pains), tension-type headaches, and cluster headaches. Frequent headaches can affect relationships and employment. There is also an increased risk of depression in those with severe headaches. 
Headaches can occur as a result of many conditions whether serious or not. There are a number of different classification systems for headaches. The most well-recognized is that of the International Headache Society. Causes of headaches may include dehydration, fatigue, sleep deprivation, stress, the effects of medications, the effects of recreational drugs, viral infections, loud noises, common colds, head injury, rapid ingestion of a very cold food or beverage, and dental or sinus issues.
Treatment of a headache depends on the underlying cause, but commonly involves pain medication. A headache is one of the most commonly experienced of all physical discomforts.
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Headache symptoms, Headache Management & Headache causes.
Here are features that make this app better than all other Headache Disease apps - 
-	UI of app is very user responsive and easy to navigate. 
-	Easily Change the page.
-	Data of app is collected from various research reports.
-	You can access these favorites whenever you want.
-	Share your favorite benefits with your friends and family through email, SMS, Twitter, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

All these features are available for free.

title: Lifestyle Migraine Therapy
description:
Lifestyle Migraine Therapy is a clinically-validated app employing methods of Regular Lifestyle Behavior (RLB) protocol for controlling migraine attacks. Migraine is a cyclic headache condition that occurs as a result of triggers. Synchronizing with biorhythms (e.g. regular sleep time) improve the coping mechanism of an individual against migraine triggers. This is known as homeodynamics i.e. one's capacity to adjust to changes in internal or external environment. The RLB protocol has been tested among 350 participants with migraine at the Stanford Headache Clinic, California, USA. Those participants who engaged with RLB protocol were found to have fewer migraine burden compared to those who do not. The details of the study published is available at the following link. By virtue of being lifestyle-based, the RLB protocol is patient-centric and avoids drug-related unwanted adverse effects.
  
Woldeamanuel YW, Cowan RP. The impact of regular lifestyle behavior in
migraine: a prevalence case-referent study. J Neurol. 2016 Apr;263(4):669-76. 

https://www.researchgate.net/publication/291951585_The_impact_of_regular_lifestyle_behavior_in_migraine_a_prevalence_case-referent_study
descriptionHTML:
Lifestyle Migraine Therapy is a clinically-validated app employing methods of Regular Lifestyle Behavior (RLB) protocol for controlling migraine attacks. Migraine is a cyclic headache condition that occurs as a result of triggers. Synchronizing with biorhythms (e.g. regular sleep time) improve the coping mechanism of an individual against migraine triggers. This is known as homeodynamics i.e. one's capacity to adjust to changes in internal or external environment. The RLB protocol has been tested among 350 participants with migraine at the Stanford Headache Clinic, California, USA. Those participants who engaged with RLB protocol were found to have fewer migraine burden compared to those who do not. The details of the study published is available at the following link. By virtue of being lifestyle-based, the RLB protocol is patient-centric and avoids drug-related unwanted adverse effects.

Woldeamanuel YW, Cowan RP. The impact of regular lifestyle behavior in
migraine: a prevalence case-referent study. J Neurol. 2016 Apr;263(4):669-76.

https://www.researchgate.net/publication/291951585_The_impact_of_regular_lifestyle_behavior_in_migraine_a_prevalence_case-referent_study
summary: Lifestyle Migraine Therapy is a clinically-proven app for controlling migraine.
